definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Must strict military discipline is the primary problem.
sentences.chinese: 肯定严明军纪是首要问题啊。

sentences.english: So much for the army discipline.
Its officers enforced strict discipline, yet had no rank.
sentences.chinese: 它的军官纪律严明，却没有军衔。

sentences.english: When the soldiers are not disordered, discipline will be well maintained.
sentences.chinese: 士卒不混乱，纪律就严明了。

sentences.english: Above is the report by VOA correspondent Yan Ming from Toronto.
sentences.chinese: 以上是美国之音特约记者严明从多伦多发来的报道。

sentences.english: They are admired for their labour discipline.
sentences.chinese: 他们由于劳动纪律严明而受到人们的钦佩。

sentences.english: He is made of Luoyang, and his upright, without fear of power, strict law enforcement.
sentences.chinese: 他是洛阳令，为人刚正，不畏权势，执法严明。

sentences.english: The army is strict in discipline.

sentences.chinese: 他们纪律严明地一齐射击。

sentences.english: 'But it's a complicated market that requires significant discipline and thoughtfulness.'
sentences.chinese: 但中国市场情况复杂，需要纪律严明与深思熟虑。

sentences.english: The soldier showed perfect discipline under fire.
sentences.chinese: 在炮火下，士兵们纪律严明。

definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
lit. if he orders you go, he forbids you stop (idiom); fig. to demand exact compliance with instructions/to ensure strictly obedience
strict/serious/solemn/dignified/to tidy up/to clean up/to purge/to adjust
to do things right/to use the correct method
(idiom) (of soldiers) highly disciplined, not committing the slightest offence against civilians
